revised_title: Variations of Latency in Skeletal Muscles of Different Animals
tldr: The authors investigate the variations in the duration of the latent period of contraction in skeletal muscles of different animals, including frogs, toads, tortoises, and warm-blooded animals. They find that the latencies for different muscles of the same animal have a proportional relationship, but the relationship varies between different animal groups. The study provides insights into the functional adaptations of muscles in different animals and their motor requirements.
